title: First Stride Coaching
text:
ryan@firststridecoaching.com

 Ryan is the owner and head coach at First Stride Coaching. During Ryan’s 15+ year running career, he has competed in every distance from one to one hundred miles. He obtained his bachelors degree from Juniata College in Biology and a Ph.D. in Microbiology from the Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences in Maryland.

title: First Stride Coaching
text:
Personal Coaching



Prior to signing up, we’ll ask you to complete a brief questionnaire to gather information about your running experience, goals, injury history, training preferences, and environment. If we need any additional details, we’ll be sure to reach out to you!
You will need to create an account on Final Surge, the training platform used by First Stride Coaching. We also recommend downloading the Final Surge app to your phone for added convenience. Get it on Google Play or the Apple App Store.
A coach will send you a Coaching Invitation through Final Surge. You’ll also receive the invite via email.
We then craft a customized training plan to meet your specific running goal(s). The plan will be made available to you through Final Surge.
If you have any questions or want to tweak the plan, our coaches are here to help! Just let us know, and we’ll work together to make sure your plan fits just right.
Once your plan is set, simply open Final Surge to access your daily workout. Then, strap on your GPS running watch, and start running!
After finishing your run, you’ll upload it to your preferred run tracking platform. See a full list of supported platforms here.
Make sure Final Surge is connected to your run platform of choice so that our coaches can check your progress.
Ask us anything! You can message your coach through Final Surge at any time.







  
  
  Button Navigation
  
  



Sign Up Today!

title: First Stride Coaching
text:
Welcome to First Stride Coaching

Your first step towards achieving your running goals! Whether you’re taking your initial steps into running, aiming to smash a personal best, or training for marathons and beyond, we’re here to guide, support, and push you to new heights. Here’s why runners of all levels choose us:




Personalized Training Plans: Tailored to your goals, fitness level, your running environment, and lifestyle.
Expert Coaching: Benefit from certified coaches who are experienced runners themselves.
Simplicity: Online-only training seamlessly fits your busy life, at a fraction of the cost of in-person coaching.
Welcoming to All: We welcome runners of all backgrounds and experiences, especially if you’ve never worked with a coach before.

title: First Stride Coaching
text:
How Does it Work?





Fill out a short questionnaire to help our coaches tailor a training plan just for you!










Our coaches will work with you to make necessary adjustments to your training plan.










Lace up your shoes and start training!










Got questions? Message your coach anytime! They’ll also check in with workout recaps, plan tweaks, and race tips to keep you motivated and on track!

title: First Stride Coaching
text:
Why First Stride Coaching
At First Stride Coaching, you get the best of both worlds: convenience and affordability. Our online platform fits your busy schedule, providing coaching wherever and whenever you need it, all at a fraction of the cost of traditional in-person coaching.
But it’s not just about the savings – our experienced coaches are dedicated to making your fitness journey enjoyable and effective. With personalized guidance and support, hitting your personal fitness milestones becomes both seamless and fun.
Ready to take the first stride? Let’s do this together!





  
  
  Button Navigation
  
  



Sign Up Today!

title: First Stride Coaching
text:
Frequently Asked Questions

  
    
      
        Do I really need a Running Coach?
      
    
    
      A running coach will provide personalized guidance tailored to your unique strengths, weaknesses, and goals. Every athlete is unique, and there's no such thing as a "one size fits all" training plan.A coach can offer customized training plans, expert feedback, and accountability that you can't get on your own. With a coach by your side, you'll maximize your potential, avoid common pitfalls and injuries, and achieve your running goals faster and more efficiently.
    
  
  
  
  
    
      
        Do I need to commit to multiple months?
      
    
    
      Nope! There is no long-term commitments here! While we're confident you'll love what we offer, if it's not your speed, you can cancel your subscription anytime hassle-free.
    
  
  
  
  
    
      
        What if I don't want to give up my normal gym routine?
      
    
    
      No need to stop doing what you already love! If you want to stick with your weight-lifting routine, that's great! We can adjust your training plan to incorporate the runs needed to tackle both your strength and running goals.
    
  
  
  
  
    
      
        What if I've never run before?
      
    
    
      At First Stride Coaching, we cater to everyone – regardless of your running experience, age, weight, or anything else. We're here to support you on your journey, no matter where you're starting from.
    
  
  
  
  
    
      
        What types of races can you help with?
      
    
    
      We offer coaching for any distance! Whether you're aiming to improve your mile time or gearing up for your first 100-mile ultramarathon, we've got your back!
    
  
  
  
  
    
      
        Do I need a running GPS watch?
      
    
    
      Yes, you will need a GPS watch and upload your runs to any of the supported platforms.As part of First Stride Coaching, you will be given a monthly subscription to Final Surge Athlete Premium, which comes with 20% off Garmin Products!
    
  
  
  
  
    
      
        How do I interact with my coach?
      
    
    
      To make things easier for you, all communication is handled through our training platform, Final Surge. Your training plan will also be delivered through Final Surge. Of course, our coaches are also reachable via email if needed!

title: FSC Blog
text:
Running With Music






music


running



After years of searching, I finally found my ideal music/podcast setup for running! 





May 4, 2024


Ryan Johnson






No matching items

title: Running With Music
text:
Depending on what you’re training for, you could be out on a run for 1, 2, maybe even 3+ hours. When there’s not much to look at, long runs can get boring fast. Or maybe you just need a distraction to get you through a tough workout.
I’m not a huge fan of running with my clunky phone, unless I have a running vest on. I also prefer to keep things as minimal as possible. I’ve spent 5 years trying to find the perfect music player/headphone combination, and I’m excited to share my findings! I’ll also share my “runner up” music setup.

title: Running With Music test
text:
This is my blog post.


Please enable JavaScript to view the comments powered by Disqus.

title: Running With Music
text:
Garmin Forerunner 965





5 years ago, my current music running setup wasn’t possible. But now, many GPS running watches have music/podcast storage and bluetooth pairing with headphones. It’s not cheap, but I currently run with the Garmin Forerunner 965. I use the Spotify app within Garmin Connect to add custom playlists and podcasts to my watch before I head out for a run. Once it’s configured, you can add Spotify playlists/podcasts all from the watch interface.

title: Running With Music
text:
Shokz OpenRun





You should always be aware of your surroundings when running, which is why I currently run with OpenRun bone conducting headphones from Shokz. These pair beautifully with my watch and allow me to hear the world around me in addition to my music. The battery life is solid; I’ve only ran out of juice during my ultra-marathons (5+ hours). If you do decide to use your phone instead of your watch, you can also take calls with these headphones.

title: Running With Music
text:
Runner Up





There used to be a popular iPod perfect for running called the iPod Shuffle. If you’re looking for something similar in the post-iPod era, then check out Mighty. It worked well with the openrun headphones, and easily clips onto your shirt/shorts. I used the Mighty for about a year, and my only negative feedback is that without a screen, it can sometime be challenging to pair and sync songs with your phone.
Happy Running!!
